lead_paragraph: Judge Barry G. Williams has a long history of involvement in police brutality trials as a prosecutor in federal cases.

byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg contributed reporting from Washington. Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

headline.print_headline: Judge in Baltimore Sets High Bar for Prosecution in Police Misconduct Trials
headline.main: In Freddie Gray Trials, Baltimore Judge Sets High Bar for Prosecution

snippet: Judge Barry G. Williams has a long history of involvement in police brutality trials as a prosecutor in federal cases.
abstract: Baltimore Judge Barry G Williams has emerged as central to court proceedings against police officers involved in death of Freddie Gray while in police custody; WIlliams, who has ruled to acquit both Officer Edward M Nero and Officer Caesar R Goodson Jr, has long history of work in civil rights division of Justice Dept, which has given him wealth of experience to bring to bear in police misconduct trials.
